PAD_Suggestions_FightStarted.synopsis: Seeing Farlin and Cairos about to come to blows, the player debates whether it's worth getting involved.
PAD_Suggestions_FightStarted.how_to_trigger: Go closer to the imminent conflict between The Guild and Smugglers.

AttackersHarper_Dead.synopsis: The Harper from the The Guild - the attacker group, fell in combat between the attackers forces and the Smugglers from Stone Man's group. Since she died, we give the players another chance to get some information about what happened.
AttackersHarper_Dead.how_to_trigger: 1) Go to Smugglers Cave (or BGO_KidnapperCave bookmark)2) Enter the cave.3) Choose the side of the Attackers.4) Make sure the Harper dies.5) Cast Speak with Dead on the Harper.

PreConflict.synopsis: Battle is about to begin between the Attackers (Farlin's The Guild's force) and the Smugglers (Cairos's Stone Man's forces) who are obviously overwhelmingly stronger. The Guild under-estimated the power of the Stone Man.The Attackers have already suffered significant loses against traps and an ealier ambush.  The Attacker's leader, Farlin sees the player's party and decides to enlist their help - despite not knowing who they are, desperate as she is.If the player agrees, the Attackers will turn allies for the duration of the encounter (unless players directly attacks them).Smugglers are hostile to both Attackers and players - despite their choices. You after all did just want into their smuggling operations uninvited.The players may choose to not get involved, in which case the attackers will lose without the players help.
PreConflict.how_to_trigger: 1. Teleport there "goto -124.84, 3.94, 95.70"or1. Saved bookmark is "Kidnappers Cave".2. Run into the nearby cave.3. Be spotted by the either the Smugglers or Attackers.

AD_RunAway.synopsis: If Farlin dies in combat, other guilders run away after combat having this AD.
AD_RunAway.how_to_trigger: Start combat in Smuggler's Cave, kill Farlin and all smugglers.

PAD_Suggestions.synopsis: Seeing Farlin and Cairos about to come to blows, the player debates whether it's worth getting involved.
PAD_Suggestions.how_to_trigger: Go closer to the imminent conflict between The Guild and Smugglers.

PAD_FoundTadpoles.synopsis: In the Smugglers Cave, after dispatching the Smugglers, players can find a few barrels of tadpoles.This PAD is triggered when players come near it and make a comment about it.

AD_DyingAttacker.synopsis: A dying man, part of The Guild that's assaulting the Smuggler's Cave, lies on the ground dying.
AD_DyingAttacker.how_to_trigger: 1. Go to bookmarked location "BGO_KidnappersCave".2. Walk into the cave area.3. Dying person would be along the way into the cave.4. AD will play automatically until the player interacts with him.

AttackersLeader.synopsis: The battle has ended with all the Smugglers dead. The Attacker Leader Farlin must have survived.

PAD_FoundDeadBody.synopsis: Players will approach a dead body.  A simple Medicine check DC 5 will inform the player that the corpse is still warm, thereby his death was very recent.A failed attempt will cause a more general statement about how very dead the body looks.
PAD_FoundDeadBody.how_to_trigger: Walk near the dead body in Smuggler's Cave.

DyingAttacker.synopsis: A dying man, part of Stone Lord's crew, lies on the ground dying. His crew have been attacked by the Guild while attempting to smuggle goods through the city.Players may approach the man, he will whisper his last words and takes his last breath.
DyingAttacker.how_to_trigger: 1. Go to bookmarked location "BGO_KidnappersCave".2. Walk into the cave area.3. Dying person would be along the way into the cave.4. Interact with him.5. He will die as soon as dialogue ends.

AD_BeforeFight.synopsis: Players enter a cave where there can see a pitch battle between Farlin and Caïros forces are about to be underway.When the players approach closer, players will overhear |Attackers|(Farlins forces from The Guild) and Smugglers (Cairo's forces from Stone Man) taunting each other.
AD_BeforeFight.how_to_trigger: 1. Go to bookmarked location "BGO_KidnappersCave".2. Walk into the cave area.

PAD_SawMoonriseShip.synopsis: Players saw the ship docked in the Smugglers Cave, and recall that the ship was seen in Moonrise Towers too.
PAD_SawMoonriseShip.how_to_trigger: 1) Go to Smugglers Cave (or BGO_KidnapperCave bookmark)2) Approach the ship, 3) PAD will trigger.

AD_SmugglerLeader.synopsis: When all the Attackers have been defeated, the Smuggler Leader will start barking to his remaining people commands to load up the ship.
AD_SmugglerLeader.how_to_trigger: All attackers must have died.The Smuggler Leader must survive.Players are not seen by any remaining Smuggler - else combat will just begin again.

AttackersLeader_Dead.synopsis: Farlin, the attackers from The Guild, fell in combat between her forces and the Smugglers from Stone Man's group. Since she died, we give the players another chance to get some information about what happened.

AD_FightImminent.synopsis: Players enter a cave where there can see a pitch battle between Farlin and Caïros forces are about to be underway.The first line’s speaker is Cairos. The second line’s speaker is Farlin. When the players approach even closer, they will trigger an invisible area which will begin this final AD between the Attackers and Smugglers before the fight between them begins.
AD_FightImminent.how_to_trigger: 1. Go to bookmarked location "BGO_KidnappersCave".2. Walk into the cave area.3. Approach close and would automatically trigger the AD.

PAD_Suggestions_FightStarted_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Suggestions_FightStarted_0.text: A fight begins! And every head in it deserves to get broken! What luck!

AttackersHarper_Dead_12.speaker: Narrator
AttackersHarper_Dead_12.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

AttackersHarper_Dead_16.speaker: Archer Velicia
AttackersHarper_Dead_16.text: Stone Lord's thugs... threat to us all...

AttackersHarper_Dead_17.speaker: Narrator
AttackersHarper_Dead_17.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

PreConflict_9.speaker: Caïros
PreConflict_9.text: Nobody messes with the Stone Lord, ratling.

PreConflict_22.speaker: Minsc
PreConflict_22.text: Well. That is not entirely true.
PreConflict_22.context: NodeContext: SHEEPISH INTERJECTION BETWEEN TWO CROOKS SAYING THE STONE LORD IS UNBEATABLE.

PreConflict_25.speaker: Farlin
PreConflict_25.text: Nine-Fingers sends her love, arsehole. Your Stone Lord's a dead man walking.

PreConflict_24.speaker: Farlin
PreConflict_24.text: You - help me kill these arses! The Guild will sprinkle you with gold.
PreConflict_24.context: NodeContext: Keen to enlist the player (and confident in her offer)

PreConflict_14.speaker: Player
PreConflict_14.text: I could go for some spoils - I'm in.

PreConflict_17.speaker: Caïros
PreConflict_17.text: You picked the wrong side, cuck.
PreConflict_17.context: NodeContext: Unphased; confident he'll kill the player

PreConflict_5.speaker: Farlin
PreConflict_5.context: NodeContext: Almost frenzied; she's keen to slice

PreConflict_10.speaker: Player
PreConflict_10.text: This Stone Lord sounds like a better bet.

PreConflict_16.speaker: Caïros
PreConflict_16.text: The Stone Lord doesn't need your help, cuck. Nobody but us leaves this place alive.
PreConflict_16.context: NodeContext: Amused; just about stops himself from laughing out loud

PreConflict_18.speaker: Player
PreConflict_18.text: Minsc, they keep mentioning the Stone Lord. Time to introduce yourself?

PreConflict_4.speaker: Minsc
PreConflict_4.text: Minsc is Minsc. Minsc was once this Lord of Stone - but he got better.

PreConflict_19.speaker: Farlin
PreConflict_19.text: Oh shit, that's the Stone Lord?

PreConflict_26.speaker: Caïros
PreConflict_26.text: Nah, they're lying - that big lump's nowhere near old enough.

PreConflict_27.speaker: Farlin
PreConflict_27.text: Stone Lord liars... Stone Lord toelickers - you all get sliced just the same.
PreConflict_27.context: NodeContext: resolved, angry, ready to fight

PreConflict_30.speaker: Player
PreConflict_30.text: I'd rather not get involved in whatever this is.

PreConflict_20.speaker: Caïros
PreConflict_20.text: Too late, cuck. Nobody but us leaves this place alive.

PreConflict_11.speaker: Player
PreConflict_11.text: I think I'll just kill both of you and take everything, thanks.

PreConflict_1.speaker: Farlin
PreConflict_1.context: NodeContext: Resentful; she WILL make you regret it

PreConflict_12.speaker: Player
PreConflict_12.text: Can't we just all get along? Must we really fight?

PreConflict_2.speaker: Caïros
PreConflict_2.text: A pacifist. In Baldur's Gate? Ha. Nobody's leaving this place alive, cuck.

PreConflict_28.speaker: Player
PreConflict_28.text: Minsc no longer answers to the Stone Lord - and the dead do not walk. Allow my hamster to show you.

AD_RunAway_0.speaker: Bug Bludgeon
AD_RunAway_0.context: NodeContext: after a combat that his side lost - panicked

PAD_Suggestions_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Suggestions_0.text: Looks like those two are about to fight...

PAD_FoundTadpoles_0.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundTadpoles_0.text: Tadpoles, smuggled into the city. Wonder how many are already here.

AD_DyingAttacker_1.context: NodeContext: Dying. Muttering as he bleeds out on the floor of a cave..

AD_DyingAttacker_8.context: NodeContext: Dying. Muttering as he bleeds out on the floor of a cave..

AD_DyingAttacker_12.context: NodeContext: Dying. Muttering as he bleeds out on the floor of a cave..

AD_DyingAttacker_5.context: NodeContext: Dying. Muttering the name of a god as he bleeds out on the floor of a cave..

AD_DyingAttacker_7.context: NodeContext: Dying. Muttering the name of a god as he bleeds out on the floor of a cave..

AD_DyingAttacker_9.context: NodeContext: Dying. Muttering the name of a god as he bleeds out on the floor of a cave..

AD_DyingAttacker_3.text: ...if any of you bastards are listening, just get this over with.
AD_DyingAttacker_3.context: NodeContext: Dying. Muttering as he bleeds out on the floor of a cave.

AD_DyingAttacker_10.context: NodeContext: Dying. Muttering as he bleeds out on the floor of a cave..

AD_DyingAttacker_0.context: NodeContext: Dying. Muttering as he bleeds out on the floor of a cave..

AD_DyingAttacker_2.text: ...in a bed of my own guts.
AD_DyingAttacker_2.context: NodeContext: Dying. Muttering as he bleeds out on the floor of a cave..

AD_DyingAttacker_11.context: NodeContext: Dying. Muttering as he bleeds out on the floor of a cave..

AD_DyingAttacker_6.text: ...Friend or foe? Guildsman or stone bastard?
AD_DyingAttacker_6.context: NodeContext: Dying. Muttering as he bleeds out on the floor of a cave..

AD_DyingAttacker_4.context: NodeContext: Dying. Muttering as he bleeds out on the floor of a cave..

AttackersLeader_19.speaker: Farlin
AttackersLeader_19.text: Scurry off back to the streets now.

AttackersLeader_49.speaker: Farlin
AttackersLeader_49.text: You did good, stranger. Some would have tried to slink away rather than get involved.
AttackersLeader_49.context: NodeContext: Clearly a little too into the bloody combat she has just won

AttackersLeader_39.speaker: Farlin
AttackersLeader_39.text: They wouldn't earn the gratitude of the Guild.

AttackersLeader_59.speaker: Player
AttackersLeader_59.text: I don't particularly want gratitude from criminals.

AttackersLeader_17.speaker: Farlin
AttackersLeader_17.text: The real criminals are the patriars slapping each other on the back in Wyrm's Rock while the people die in the streets.

AttackersLeader_20.speaker: Farlin
AttackersLeader_20.text: The Guild keeps order - and looks out for the little man.

AttackersLeader_41.speaker: Player
AttackersLeader_41.text: Really? Does anyone actually believe that?

AttackersLeader_42.speaker: Player
AttackersLeader_42.text: Are you going to pay me for helping clean up this scum?

AttackersLeader_57.speaker: Farlin
AttackersLeader_57.text: Of course - the Guild always rewards good work.

AttackersLeader_12.speaker: Player
AttackersLeader_12.text: Happy to help - who did we just kill?

AttackersLeader_30.speaker: Farlin
AttackersLeader_30.text: A new flavour of scum that's been muscling in on our business.

AttackersLeader_25.speaker: Player
AttackersLeader_25.text: Stone Lord? Never heard of him.

AttackersLeader_31.speaker: Farlin
AttackersLeader_31.text: He's a newcomer to our delightful underworld. And he doesn't play nice with others.

AttackersLeader_50.speaker: Player
AttackersLeader_50.text: I heard the Stone Lord's name from a dying man. Who is he?

AttackersLeader_3.speaker: Player
AttackersLeader_3.text: Let me guess - some kind of golem crime boss?

AttackersLeader_35.speaker: Farlin
AttackersLeader_35.text: Nobody actually knows. Word is he's big, dense, tough as rocks.

AttackersLeader_24.speaker: Farlin
AttackersLeader_24.text: But human. We think. And definitely ruthless.

AttackersLeader_11.speaker: Player
AttackersLeader_11.text: What were his agents doing here?

AttackersLeader_46.speaker: Farlin
AttackersLeader_46.text: We think the Stone Lord and his cronies are in league with the Absolute cultists. This little operation here certainly suggests so.

AttackersLeader_16.speaker: Farlin
AttackersLeader_16.text: They were shifting something valuable by boat. But that something belongs to the Guild now.

AttackersLeader_8.speaker: Player
AttackersLeader_8.text: I deserve a little something for helping you.

AttackersLeader_14.speaker: Player
AttackersLeader_14.text: I'll leave you to your spoils then. Goodbye.

AttackersLeader_7.speaker: Player
AttackersLeader_7.text: Surely he can't stand against the Guild?

AttackersLeader_34.speaker: Farlin
AttackersLeader_34.text: We think he's in league with the Absolute cultists. This little operation here certainly suggests so.

AttackersLeader_44.speaker: Farlin
AttackersLeader_44.text: The Guild always wins in the end. But this Stone Lord is trouble.

AttackersLeader_13.speaker: Player
AttackersLeader_13.text: I deserve a little something for helping protect your operations.

AttackersLeader_52.speaker: Player
AttackersLeader_52.text: Thanks for the tip - I'll bear that in mind. Goodbye.

AttackersLeader_18.speaker: Player
AttackersLeader_18.text: So am I - I'll be taking everything.

AttackersLeader_58.speaker: Player
AttackersLeader_58.text: I don't play nice with others either - time to die.

AttackersLeader_6.speaker: Player
AttackersLeader_6.text: I reckon I deserve a reward for killing his agents.

AttackersLeader_22.speaker: Player
AttackersLeader_22.text: I'm rather ruthless too. Time to die.

AttackersLeader_21.speaker: Farlin
AttackersLeader_21.text: Traitorous little guttersnipe - I'll cut you to offal!

AttackersLeader_27.speaker: Farlin
AttackersLeader_27.text: He is. Nobody has actually seen him, but word is he's tough as rocks, and ruthless as an ettin.

AttackersLeader_48.speaker: Farlin
AttackersLeader_48.text: One usually follows the other. Here you go.

AttackersLeader_38.speaker: Player
AttackersLeader_38.text: Who did I just kill to earn that coin?

PAD_FoundDeadBody_0.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundDeadBody_0.context: InternalNodeContext: Played when Medicine check succeeds.

PAD_FoundDeadBody_1.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundDeadBody_1.text: Gods, what happened to his head?
PAD_FoundDeadBody_1.context: InternalNodeContext: Played when Medicine check fails.

DyingAttacker_4.speaker: Dying Stone Lord Thug
DyingAttacker_4.context: NodeContext: In almost unspeakable pain (and likely choking on his own blood a bit)

DyingAttacker_8.speaker: Dying Stone Lord Thug
DyingAttacker_8.text: Tell the others... Let the boss know...
DyingAttacker_8.context: NodeContext: In almost unspeakable pain - but desperate to be heard

DyingAttacker_13.speaker: Narrator
DyingAttacker_13.text: *This man is not long for this world.*

DyingAttacker_15.speaker: Dying Stone Lord Thug
DyingAttacker_15.text: Stone Lord... he'll sort this. He'll get 'em...
DyingAttacker_15.context: NodeContext: Struggling through the pain and blood loss

DyingAttacker_6.speaker: Dying Stone Lord Thug
DyingAttacker_6.context: NodeContext: Struggling through the pain and blood loss

DyingAttacker_0.speaker: Narrator
DyingAttacker_0.text: *You hear the blood gurgle in his struggling lungs - his last ounce of strength is spent.*

DyingAttacker_7.speaker: Narrator
DyingAttacker_7.text: *It's too late - this man is far beyond anyone's help.*

DyingAttacker_16.speaker: Narrator
DyingAttacker_16.text: *Your intervention is barely needed - the strike only hastens his fate by mere, agonising moments.*

AD_BeforeFight_4.speaker: Caïros
AD_BeforeFight_4.text: End of the line, Guildy - you shouldn't've trusted those mice you call men.
AD_BeforeFight_4.context: NodeContext: Getting a little wear of her threats

AD_BeforeFight_6.speaker: Farlin
AD_BeforeFight_6.text: We've killed lots of you so far, haven't we? We'll kill more.
AD_BeforeFight_6.context: NodeContext: Spirited threat; she's confident in her ability to kill him

AD_BeforeFight_2.speaker: Caïros
AD_BeforeFight_2.text: Or I'll crush you like the cockroach you are!
AD_BeforeFight_2.context: NodeContext: Starting to get annoyed at her now

AD_BeforeFight_7.speaker: Farlin
AD_BeforeFight_7.text: I'll snip off your horns one by one!

AD_BeforeFight_0.speaker: Caïros
AD_BeforeFight_0.text: Empty threats, all of them. Rot-brained ratling.
AD_BeforeFight_0.context: NodeContext: Confused by her weird way of talking; dismissive

AD_BeforeFight_1.speaker: Farlin
AD_BeforeFight_1.text: You won't be saying that when I core your skull like an apple!
AD_BeforeFight_1.context: NodeContext: Spirited threat - she's enjoying this

AD_BeforeFight_8.speaker: Farlin
AD_BeforeFight_8.text: I'd like to see you try - all talk, I think.

AD_BeforeFight_5.speaker: Caïros
AD_BeforeFight_5.text: I will crush you. I'm just being charitable.
AD_BeforeFight_5.context: NodeContext: Annoyance rising (but trying to keep his cool)

AD_BeforeFight_3.speaker: Farlin
AD_BeforeFight_3.text: I am more than ready for you to try.

PAD_SawMoonriseShip_0.speaker: Player
PAD_SawMoonriseShip_0.text: That same ship was at Moonrise Towers, if I'm not mistaken.

AD_SmugglerLeader_5.speaker: Caïros
AD_SmugglerLeader_5.text: Do not drop the cargo! Break a crate and I break your head!
AD_SmugglerLeader_5.context: NodeContext: Impatiently ordering his men around

AD_SmugglerLeader_7.speaker: Caïros
AD_SmugglerLeader_7.text: The Stone Lord is particular about his cargo, he is.
AD_SmugglerLeader_7.context: NodeContext: Impatiently ordering his men around

AD_SmugglerLeader_2.speaker: Caïros
AD_SmugglerLeader_2.text: And I mean to stay on his more-or-less good side.
AD_SmugglerLeader_2.context: NodeContext: Impatiently ordering his men around

AD_SmugglerLeader_8.speaker: Caïros
AD_SmugglerLeader_8.text: So much for the Guild shits.
AD_SmugglerLeader_8.context: NodeContext: Dispassionately surveying the slaughter he wrought

AD_SmugglerLeader_3.speaker: Caïros
AD_SmugglerLeader_3.text: Fun's over! Get this cargo on the ship.

AD_SmugglerLeader_10.speaker: Caïros
AD_SmugglerLeader_10.text: Got to get this stuff to the Counting House pronto! Or the Stone Lord will have your hides!

AD_SmugglerLeader_9.speaker: Caïros
AD_SmugglerLeader_9.text: Come on, come on, pick up the pace, you slugs.
AD_SmugglerLeader_9.context: NodeContext: Angry; one of his men almost dropped something important

AD_SmugglerLeader_0.speaker: Caïros
AD_SmugglerLeader_0.text: If we're late, I'm telling the Stone Lord it's your fault.
AD_SmugglerLeader_0.context: NodeContext: Angry; one of his men almost dropped something important

AD_SmugglerLeader_1.speaker: Caïros
AD_SmugglerLeader_1.text: Is that what you want, you spineless ochre jellies?
AD_SmugglerLeader_1.context: NodeContext: Annoyed and a little weary

AD_SmugglerLeader_11.speaker: Caïros
AD_SmugglerLeader_11.text: Move it! Move it, for the love of dog!

AD_SmugglerLeader_6.speaker: Caïros
AD_SmugglerLeader_6.text: If we make it, I got some fun waiting for me at the Blushing Mermaid.

AD_SmugglerLeader_4.speaker: Caïros
AD_SmugglerLeader_4.text: If we don't make it, you got some pain waiting for you!
AD_SmugglerLeader_4.context: NodeContext: Annoyed and a little weary

AttackersLeader_Dead_13.speaker: Narrator
AttackersLeader_Dead_13.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

AttackersLeader_Dead_17.speaker: Narrator
AttackersLeader_Dead_17.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

AD_FightImminent_1.speaker: Caïros
AD_FightImminent_1.text: You little Guild shit! Time to die!
AD_FightImminent_1.context: NodeContext: About to attack (and extremely ready to)

AD_FightImminent_0.speaker: Farlin
AD_FightImminent_0.text: Run your mouth, Caïros. My blade does my talking!
AD_FightImminent_0.context: NodeContext: Almost frenzied; she's keen to slice
